page.title: 08LARKHILL SOILING FACTORY 2
page.content: All the equipment in Larkhill is driven by Electricity and the heating by steam,produced by oil or gas heated boilers. The Rubber is mixed in a machine called the{'Banbury'}and the batch of fifteen different materials weighing 230 kilos is mixed every 5 minutes. This mixed compound is then sheeted off and subjected to further processes known as moulding.The moulding process is by means of presses which squeeze the compound into shape and vulcanize by means of heat.Vulcanisation is a chemical change which converts the compounds from a Plastercine like material into a Rubber.Substitute suitable for shoe soles.
